item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Do it or don't. It's amazing how many things in life are that easy." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "You don't make me feel like you used to. That's why I'm leaving That's why people leave each other They come to their senses and get selfish again." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.
item.description: "Thanks to TV and for the convenience of TV, you can only be one of two kinds of human beings, either a liberal or a conservative." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If I should ever die, God forbid, I hope you will say, 'Kurt is up in heaven now.' That's my favorite joke." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "They're certainly entitled to think that, and they're entitled to full respect for their opinions... but before I can live with other folks I've got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Karen add a quote by Barbara Ehrenreich
item.description: "When someone works for less pay than she can live on — when, for example, she goes hungry so that you can eat more cheaply and conveniently — then she has made a great sacrifice for you, she has made you a gift of some part of her abilities, her health, and her life. The 'working poor,' as they are approvingly termed, are in fact the major philanthropists of our society. They neglect their own children so that the children of others will be cared for; they live in substandard housing so that other homes will be shiny and perfect; they endure privation so that inflation will be low and stock prices high. To be a member of the working poor is to be an anonymous donor, a nameless benefactor, to everyone else." -- Barbara Ehrenreich

item.title: Karen add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "You have to die a few times before you can really live." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Joy is the best makeup." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Karen add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Tis' better to live your own life imperfectly than to imitate someone else's perfectly." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Karen add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will." -- Stephen King

item.title: Karen add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "I haven't the slightest idea how to change people, but still I keep a long list of prospective candidates just in case I should ever figure it out." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Karen add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you aren't cute, you may as well be clever." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Karen add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Give me lust, baby. Flash. Give me malice. Flash. Give me detached existentialist ennui. Flash. Give me rampant intellectualism as a coping mechanism. Flash." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Karen add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Karen add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Remembrance of things past is not necessarily the remembrance of things as they were." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Karen add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jon Krakauer
item.description: "There is a dark side to religious devotion that is too often ignored or denied. As a means of motivating people to be cruel or inhumane, there may be no more potent force than religion. When the subject of religiously inspired bloodshed comes up, many Americans immediately think of Islamic fundamentalism, which is to be expected in the wake of 911. But men have been committing heinous acts in the name of God ever since mankind began believing in deities, and extremists exist within all religions. Muhammad is not the only prophet whose words have been used to sanction barbarism; history has not lacked for Christians, Jews, Hindus, Sikhs, and even Buddhists who have been motivated by scripture to butcher innocents. Plenty of these religious extremist have been homegrown, corn-fed Americans." -- Jon Krakauer

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Karen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde
